newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai rice market dull, more Philippine deals seen.
newsitem.headline: Thai rice market dull, more Philippine deals seen.

text.p: Thai rice exporters hoped the government would be able to secure more rice orders from Manila to rejuvenate the currently dull market, trade sources said on Thursday.
Prices on the generally lacklustre market have remained lacklustre this week.
Some traders said they expected the govenment to secure another 100,000 tonnes of purchases from the Philippines on top of 205,000 tonnes already committed for March/April and May/June shipments.
The Philippines National Food Authority (NFA) announced that it was seeking to import up to 650,000 tonnes of rice before the end of the third quarter this year.
"Vietnam and Pakistan will offer attractive prices, no doubt. But I still believe we should be able to compete and get more orders," said one exporter.
The price of Thai benchmark 100 percent B grade was unchanged at $370-390 per tonne FOB Bangkok while 100 percent fragrant was quoted at $620-630 per tonne on the same basis.
"Although demand was slow, prices barely dropped as the amount of supplies entering the market was low as well," said another trader.
Parboiled rice prices edged up on contracts covering for Nigeria, the sources said.
At ports, 14 vessels were loading rice to Asian and African destinations. Thailand's rice exports so far this year have dropped sharply from the corresponding period in 1996.
Rice exports during January 1-February 12 were recorded at 476,307 tonnes compared with 739,612 tonnes in the same period last year.
